ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with intellectual disability, delayed speech/language, aggressive behavior, and seizures. Most common inherited cause of intellectual disability and autism spectrum behaviors.
Features intellectual disability, severe speech impairment, and seizures. Aggressive behavior can occur, though happy demeanor is more typical.
Severe epilepsy syndrome with intellectual disability and behavioral problems. Seizures often begin as focal and generalize, matching the bilateral tonic-clonic with focal onset pattern.
Progressive disorder with intellectual disability, loss of speech, and seizures. Aggressive behaviors can manifest as irritability and screaming episodes.
Characterized by intellectual disability, speech delay, aggressive/self-injurious behaviors. Seizures occur in about 30% of cases.
Severe epileptic encephalopathy with intellectual disability, behavioral problems, and multiple seizure types including tonic-clonic seizures.
X-linked disorder with severe intellectual disability, absent or limited speech, and seizures in about 50% of cases. Behavioral issues are common.
X-linked disorder affecting females with intellectual disability, behavioral problems including aggression, and focal seizures that can generalize.
